mng: proud, arrogant, to despise, unyielding, to defy

exm.mng: proud, arrogant, to despise, unyielding, to defy
pride, arrogance, conceited, proud of sth
turn up one's nose, show disdain for, regard superciliously
Pride and prejudice, novel by Jane Austen 珍·奧斯汀|珍·奥斯汀
to be intensely proud of sth (idiom)
to be inordinately proud of one's ability, to be conceited and contemptuous (idiom)
satisfied with one's accomplishment and arrogant as a result (idiom); resting on one's laurels and despising others

exm.cur: 虚心使人进步，骄傲使人落后
exm.trd: 虛心使人進步，驕傲使人落後
exm.mng: Modesty leads to progress, arrogance makes you drop behind (favorite slogan of Mao Zedong)
exm.pyn: xū xīn shǐ rén jìn bù , jiāo ào shǐ rén luò hòu
